channel.title: Homes on Zheng Wang
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Zheng Wang

item.description: Zheng Wang I am an associate professor at the School of Computing at the University of Leeds. I am a member of the Distributed Systems and Services Group at Leeds and the HiPEAC Network of Excellence. Previously, I was a senior lecturer (~UK associate professor) in the School of Computing and Communications at Lancaster University where I led the Distributed Systems Research Group. I am interested in developing new methods and building systems to allow computers to adapt to the ever-changing environment.

item.title: News
item.description: [May, 2019] One paper accepted by IJCAI ‘19 [Feb, 2019] Received the Best Paper Award at CGO ‘19 [Nov, 2018] Our paper on function merging is accepted by CGO ‘19 [October, 2018] Our ACM CCS 2018 submission is among the best paper award finalists! (top-4 ranked papers) [July, 2018] Our paper on building a Generative Adversarial Network based captach solver is accepted by ACM CCS ‘18 [July, 2018] One paper got accepted by ACM IMWUT - Ubicomp ‘18 [May, 2018] Our work on Android pattern lock security got accepted to ACM TOPS [March, 2018] Our work on enabling large-scale wifi sensing got accepted in Mobicom 2018 [March, 2018] Our paper on optimising deep learning on embedded devices accepted in LCTES 2018

item.title: Biography
item.description: July 2018 -, Associate Professor, School of Computing, University of Leeds August 2018 - July 2019, Senior Lecturer, School of Computing and Communications, Lancaster University. Sept 2013 - July, 2018, Lecturer, School of Computing and Communications, Lancaster University. 2012 - 2013, Research Associate, the University of Edinbugh. 2007 - 2011, PhD Student, the University of Edinburgh. Aademic advisor: Professor Michael O’Boyle FBCS. 2005 - 2007, Research Staff member, IBM China
